page.title: 19Weeds on the Farm.
page.content: The farmers spray their crops in rder to improve their yield. A farmer in this area uses weedkiller twice in the Autumn and once in the Spring. The first spray kills the wild barley and the second kills the other weeds.In the Spring he sprays any weeds he has missed and later he sprays a fungicide over the crops.This will cost him about 30 pounds an acre. He tries not to use pesticides but sometimes the aphids start to destroy the crops. In 1984 he had to spray all his fields but in 1985 he has only had to spray about 30 acres. He has planted a number of trees on his land partly to discourage the growth of the weeds which do not grow well under trees. He has planted oak and ash trees this year and he is developing a three acre wood.
